message:
If there's another 2011 release I'm as excited for, I can't quite think of it now. Just three and a half weeks to go! 

In case you haven't seen it yet, this GiantBomb video's got some fantastic, non-spoilery gameplay footage. If you're not yet excited for the game, this will probably remedy it immediately: http://www.giantbomb.com/infamous-2-man-i-saw-that/17-4095/

"The Beast" teaser: http://blog.us.playstation.com/2011/05/24/infamous-2-the-beast-is-coming/

iwantitiwantitiwantitnow!
Seriously looking forward to it. It might just bump Uncharted 3 off as my most anticipated title for 2011.
Hey now.
If it's any consolation to you, I don't even read this thread.  I have no idea why I clicked on it just now.
@Neilan What I meant to say was, Uncharted 3 will own all! ... (is he gone yet?)
FF9 > Uncharted 3 *runs*
http://au.ps3.ign.com/articles/117/1170808p1.html reviews starting to come in.... Day 1 for me!
This would've been Day Minus Twenty-One for me, but given Sony's incompetence/reluctance in getting the Store back online, I wouldn't be surprised if it ends up being Day Fifty-Seven :/
I wonder if I should look into it…
On the off-chance that the PlayStation Store ever sees the light of day again (39 days, and counting), there will be a demo for it.
I don't feel like talking about Infamous 2... If you have not realised. Also, not derailing a thread is against oldschool take 2 forum rules

I had some fun on the PS3 ZA forums some time ago but in all honesty... PSN being down - it's something that never surprised me. Thought Sony's online offering was crap out of the gates. Was just a matter of time for it to stumble. What I have realised is that trophy syncing happens much faster ( yes, it's still lame that you have to sync it) but it's better. Hope the shop ends up being a bit more instant... Or am I just in a wild dreaming state?
Let's talk about Dirt 3, it's awesome online. Thought you PS3 peeps should know (so is Mortal Kombat)
Awesome online? Does that mean your phone line is finally letting you online for more than 10 seconds at a time? :P
Yes, I get about 15 secs without PSN breaking it now
This is a novel idea: certain aspects of inFamous 2 are influenced by your actions in the first game. But it looks at your trophies, instead of save files.
Then they cancel each other out, and you get nothing.
What if you have the good and evil trophies? "Cole, please save us ... or, uh, don't DESTROY us!"
Just like my school prize givings.

I didn't think much of the inclusion of a user generated missions feature in inFamous 2, but apparently some of the stuff created during the beta is quite imaginative and really good. Seems like a potentially great bonus feature.
Ugh, don't remind me :( Still, I'm making use of this opportunity to spend some quality time with Beyond Good & Evil, so I suppose it's not all bad!
Now, if only we could actually play it...
Apparently the demo is now available for download.
Eurogamer - http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-31-infamous-2-review?page=2
Regarding having both the good and evil trophies for the first game, it actually asks you which one of those "games" you want to continue in inFamous 2.

I'm nearing the end, and this is my favorite game so far this year. The improvements over the first one are not as apparent in the early sections, but become increasingly evident and significant as you progress.
Cant wait for the weekend! Going to be all about inFamous 2 come Friday!
Started playing this on Saturday and really loving it. It really feels as if they've improved on the first game in every way.

I'd *almost* agree with you, Jevous, but there are a couple of exceptions, I think. The first game had some linear, platforming-heavy sequences (sewers, prison tower, etc) which were awesome, but for which there's no equivalent in inFamous 2 :( 

Furthermore, I feel that there's nothing here to quite match the first game's best boss fights. And they definitely bungled the character of Cole a bit -- he was a bland and generic hero in the first game, but their attempts to turn him into some emotionally scarred tough-guy in the sequel just leaves him coming across as a total douche, even when you play the "good" path.

That being said, there are areas where this game excels like no other. The powers are incredibly fun, and I don't think any other game I've played has been so successful in making me feel like a dude with superpowers -- the developers of every other superhero game need to play this and take notes. Furthermore, Sucker Punch has pretty much *perfected* open-world traversal in this game. Oh man, simply moving from point A to point B is a thing of beauty here.
I didn't exactly enjoy the sewer levels in the first game but I actually do miss the boss encounters now. As for new Cole, I prefer him over old Cole.
Is it just me or is the camera the one thing that is noticeably worse in this game? Perhaps it is the fact that you rely more on melee attacks than you did in Infamous 1. Great game, though.
Haven't opened my copy yet, but THE BOX ART. It's bad, man.

Does anyone else find the news reports in this game incredibly funny? Was Empire City destroyed by an earthquake? Are TERRORISTS responsible? We can only speculate ... since it certainly wasn't the gigantic man made of lava that literally everyone could see.
@MrGenuchi LOL yeah, I agree with you on both parts. The box art is simply blegh and ... what giant lava man walking outside?
Crap, I still have this to play...
I still enjoy collecting blast shards, because inFamous makes movement so effortless and fast, but I feel like I'm on the verge of becoming bored here. Am I missing something exciting?

I really enjoyed the game but there were many parts where I felt a bit of fatigue set in. It's not a quantum leap overs it predecessor on the Uncharted 2/ Assassin's Creed 2 scale, which was what I was hoping for. Plus, I sometimes felt a near-Prototripe sense of rage at the camera in some of the up-close fighting.

Infamous 2 has a dichotomy of good and evil in design. Good: Ease of use, fast movement, improvised platforming, plentiful checkpoints. Evil: the camera that spins around when you get knocked back, enemy bullet sponges, monsters that take 14 hours to complete their death animations, boring missions, childish morality. I couldn't wait for it to be over.
Also, Nix has to be one of the most horrible characters ever. Kuo: Cole, let's distribute antibiotics! Nix: Heeeeeeeeeey, Cole... Letsa blow shiiit upppp heheh.
